resources.string: Please type in today\'s meter reading

Welcome to Solarstats.
This introduction will show you, which oppurtunities this app offers.

1. Menu
You can open the menu with a click in the top left corner or with a slide from left:
2. Data\nYou can see the stored meter readings as a table. Below, enter the value for any date. With a long click on an entry you can delete it.
3. Im- and Export\nMeter readings can be imported from an excel file (.xls). Please make sure that the file is formatted like this:

Next to each date in the left column is a value in the immediate neighboring right column. Here, each date should only occur once.\n\nBoth, meter readings and graphs, can be exported via the menu in the upper right corner. Files that are created, you can view below Exported.

4. Diagram\nYour stored data can be represented as a diagram. You have many types available. In some types you can display several solar systems in one diagram. In the menu in the upper right corner you can then select the solar systems to display.
Charts can be displayed only when a sufficient number of meter readings is stored. Sensibly they are only when data is entered regularly.

5. Manage solar systems\nSolarstats offers you the possibility to manage several solar systems. In the menu on the left hand side you can select the solar system you want to see or edit. Charts and counters always refer to this system.\nUnder Solar systems, you can manage the systems. If you have stored at least two systems, a total overview will be shown:
Assign the different solar systems colors to distinguish them in diagram. If you specify peak power and earnings per kWh, Solarstats calculates efficiency and profit per system.
6. Reminder\nTo help you remember it regularly enter the meter reading, you can be reminded in a specific rhythm. In the Settings you can activate and edit this feature.

You have now been informed of all the features of Solarstats. Please note that I look forward to suggestions for improvement. I would be delighted if you would recommend and rate the app. For more information, see Help and About this app.
You can insert data with the insertion field on the bottom of the screen.\n Also you can import data from an excel file (.xls).

Do you want to override the meter reading from %1$s?

old:				%2$s
new:			%3$s
CAUTION! Data in this range will be deleted.
CAUTION! All data so far will be delted, because they don\'t fit to the new.

No data found. Please check, if the data is saved in the correct format. You can find some more information under Help.\nYou can try to change the system language to English (US). This may help if you restart the app. Otherwise feel free to contact me.
Scan for bluetooth devices near you, please wait…
No bluetooth devices were found near you.
Do you want to delete the meter reading from %1$s?
The startmonth has to be before the endmonth
Do you want to delete this system?\n\nCAUTION! All meter readings in this system will be delted too. This cannot be undone.
No files\nYou can export meter readings and diagrams
Do you want to delete this file?\n%1$s

The table\nYour meter readings are shown in a table. In the left column is the date, in the middle the meter reading and in the right column the value how much your solar system has produced on that day. If there is the character \"~\" then it\'s an average.\nTo edit an entry, select him and type a new value in. If you want to delete an entry, then you click on him longer.

Insert data\nUse the input field at the bottom of the screen to enter the meter readings of your solar system. To the left of the input field, you can select a date. It is always checked automatically whether the input value can be correct (ie, it is at least as large as the count from the day before and at most as large as the count from the next day). The unit (kWh, MWh, etc.) your data will be stored, you can specify in the settings.

Import data (excel)\nIn the menu you can import meter readings from an excel file. Only .xls files will be accepted. You select the file from your device. Then Solarstats searches for data. The data in the excel file must be in this format, so that they can be found:
Next to each date in the left column is a value in the immediate neighboring right column. Here, each date should only occur once.

Entire data\nThis graph represents all the data that are stored. You can see by touching the graph the exact values for each day. With the menu in the top right corner you can display more solar plants if available.

Month\nIn this diagram, you can select the month to be displayed at the bottom right. There are only months in which at least two counts were saved because otherwise no chart can be generated. Here you can see also the exact values by a touch of the graph and you can also select more solar plants.

One Year\nThis column chart can give the overview of individual years. There are also at least two meter readings for a year needed so that you can select it. The diagram is useful only if you enter values regularly.
More Years\nThis diagram gives you an overview over several years. You must specify the start and end year. It is only useful with a lot of data.

Year Comparison\nThis column chart can compare two years. This is only possible if you have saved at least two meter readings for two or more years. However, this diagram form is only useful if many meter readings are available.

Choose period\nFor this chart, you must specify a time period. Again, you get through a touch of the graph the exact values of the days. Here you can also display more solar plants in one chart by selecting the systems in the top right menu.

Total overview\nIf you manage at least two solar systems or inverters with Solarstats, you get on top of the screen a list of all existing data.\nA small chart gives you an overview of the proportions of each solar system.

Individual solar system\nWith the plus symbol in the upper right corner you can add solar systems. A name, installation date and color are always necessary. Optionally, you can enter the peak power and earnings per kWh. From this data, efficiency and overall profit can be calculated.\nPlease note that the efficiency calculation is more accurate if you enter more data. So if you have only entered a few data, it may get a false efficiency values.
On this screen, all exported files are displayed. With a simple click you can open a file, by holding down you get several options. So you can send the files as e-mail.
A reminder that reminds you daily to insert the meter reading.
Caution! All meter readings will be deleted. This cannot be undone.
Transform current data to new unit

Information
For errors or suggestions for improvement please contact me at the e-mail address given below.
Many thanks to the Java Excel API open source project. The import and export of the counts work with this project.
To create PDF documents the Android PDF Writer Library is used.

resources.string: Liability for content\nAs a service provider we are responsible for our own content in this app under the general laws according to § 7 ​​paragraph 1 of TMG. According to §§ 8 to 10 TMG we are not obliged as a service provider to monitor transmitted or stored foreign information or to investigate circumstances that indicate illegal activity. Obligations to remove or block the use of information under the general laws remain unaffected. However, a relevant liability is only possible from the date of knowledge of a specific infringement. Upon notification of such violations, we will remove the content immediately.

Liability for links\nOur app contains links to external websites over which we have no control. Therefore we can not accept any responsibility for their content. The respective provider or operator of the pages is always responsible for the contents of the site. The linked sites were checked at the time of linking for possible violations of law. A permanent control of the linked pages is unreasonable without concrete evidence of a violation. Upon notification of violations, we will remove such links immediately.
